instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2532: What is 820-2532? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.TPS51125: What is TPS51125? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1278 model Macbooks.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
1. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - Yes
2. <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - Yes
3. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - no
4. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - no

External 5V - works

I have no 5v on the board.
Where I start to measure?

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: I'd start digging around <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> / <CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Do you have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL>? If it is there, check if you have a working keyboard or use power pads on the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
Ignore <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>/<CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP> and do not touch it.

<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5_MCP</SIGNAL> is measuring what voltage? 0.316v, or 1.05v? Ifit is 1.05v, does it drop when you try to turn it on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Thank you guys, I will try do that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Louis, i have on <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5_MCP</SIGNAL> 1.17v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5_MCP</SIGNAL> 1.17v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> going up when you hit the power button?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: My first question would be if <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> from <CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP> is present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present, Duke.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: No, I don't get  nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present, Duke.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: When you hit the power button does <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> change?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Also important on 15" models is that you use a known good 85W charger. Check on a working macbook if it really is recognized as 85W and not a Chinese fake one!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Nothing, Louis.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, the charge is 85W  (original)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
I got the same board with same symptoms here, no liquid damage:

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - [U]no[/U]
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - [U]no[/U]
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - [U]present[/U]
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5_MCP</SIGNAL> - [U]1.16v [/U]
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - [U]missing[/U]
no shorts to GND

what could it be?
Maybe a clock issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
Please no thread hijacking, first want to solve the OP problem. 
Is <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: So if you put 5V with your external power supply it works??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A green light but wont turn on
